title: Winter Vacation Tips: Top 3 European Ski Resorts
text:
15, 2015 
If you are already planning your winter vacation, you should consider some of the best European ski resorts, including destinations in France and Switzerland. 
With summer almost coming to its end, it is about time to start thinking about your next winter getaway. Although many of us still love to head to warm places even when the outside temperatures at home are far below zero, there is nothing more exciting than spending your holidays at a cozy ski resort. In fact, winter is approaching much faster than you might actually think: pumpkin pies, our coziest sweaters and scarfs will be back very shortly. You’d better get yourself ready and score the best winter vacation you can. Whether you are a professional skier or you are just interested in the great winter atmosphere, there are some great European ski resorts waiting for you out there. 
1. Courchevel, France. 
Commonly considered a St. Tropez style winter ski resort, Courchevel certainly deserves a particular attention. This worldwide known French resort, located in the Tarenteise Valley, is part of Les Trois Vallées, considered one of the biggest ski areas in the entire world. Thanks to its excellent lift system, stunning ski slopes and prestigious amenities, this resort is particularly famous among the VIP clientele, including George Clooney, Robbie Williams, the Beckhams and many others. Its exclusive wining and dining make of Courchevel your place of choice if you are interested in the après-ski scene. In addition, the accommodation options offer the best comfort, with a touch of exclusive style. In fact, the wide selection of luxury villas , of different sizes to best suit your needs, will guarantee the best experience in Courchevel. 
2. Dolomites, Italy 
For those who only think about Italy’s eternal cities or delicious food, here are the breaking news: Italy is also famous for its ski resorts. In particular, the Dolomites, located in Northeastern Italy, is an area that offers a great selection of stunning ski slopes, where skiers of different levels can practice their favorite sports. In addition, Dolomites hosts many national parks where you can enjoy the beautiful Italian winter nature. 
3. Zermatt, Switzerland 
Famous for many hiking trails, including the one that leads to Chamonix in France, and for being the Western terminus of Glacier Express, Zermatt is a small, car-free town, famous for its great skiing options even in summertime. Its lively après-ski scene, with a large selection of restaurants and other amenities is the key ingredient to make your stay truly unforgettable!
